title: Efficacy of Dapagliflozin in Type 2 Diabetes with Early Nephropathy in Indian Population

additional: On stable oral hypoglycemic therapy for at least 3 months

summary: A multicenter randomized controlled trial evaluating the renal protective effects of Dapagliflozin 10mg added to standard care in Indian patients with Type 2 DM and early diabetic nephropathy.

title: Belimumab Combined with Standard Therapy for Newly Diagnosed SLE in South Asian Patients

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Newly diagnosed SLE meeting ACR/EULAR 2019 criteria

summary: Evaluating the efficacy and safety of Belimumab in combination with standard immunosuppressive therapy in newly diagnosed SLE patients of South Asian descent.

title: Pembrolizumab Plus Chemotherapy as First-Line Treatment for Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

additional: No prior systemic therapy for advanced disease

summary: A Phase 3 trial comparing Pembrolizumab plus platinum-based chemotherapy versus chemotherapy alone as first-line treatment in Indian patients with advanced NSCLC expressing PD-L1.

title: Donepezil-Memantine Combination in Early Alzheimer's Disease in Indian Elderly

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Probable Alzheimer's Disease per NIA-AA criteria

summary: Evaluating early combination therapy with Donepezil and Memantine versus Donepezil monotherapy in Indian elderly patients with early to moderate Alzheimer's disease.

title: Yoga and Pranayama as Adjunct Therapy in Moderate Persistent Asthma

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Moderate persistent bronchial asthma per GINA guidelines
additional: On stable ICS-LABA therapy for at least 4 weeks

summary: A randomized controlled trial evaluating structured yoga and pranayama breathing exercises as adjunct therapy in patients with moderate persistent asthma on standard inhaler therapy.

title: GLP-1 Receptor Agonist for Cardiovascular Risk Reduction in Indian Diabetic Patients

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Type 2 DM with established cardiovascular disease or high CV risk
additional: At least one CV risk factor or established ASCVD

summary: A post-marketing study evaluating cardiovascular outcomes with Semaglutide in Indian patients with Type 2 DM and high cardiovascular risk.

title: Hydroxychloroquine Dose Optimization in Indian SLE Patients Based on Blood Levels
summary: A study to determine optimal Hydroxychloroquine dosing in Indian SLE patients using therapeutic drug monitoring to maximize efficacy while minimizing retinal toxicity risk.

title: Tiotropium-Olodaterol Fixed Combination in Indian COPD Patients

additional: Smoking history >= 10 pack-years or biomass fuel exposure
At least one exacerbation in the past year

summary: Evaluating the efficacy and safety of Tiotropium-Olodaterol fixed-dose combination versus Tiotropium monotherapy in Indian patients with moderate to severe COPD.

title: Maternal Metformin Versus Insulin for Gestational Diabetes in Indian Women

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: GDM diagnosed by IADPSG criteria between 24-32 weeks gestation

summary: A non-inferiority trial comparing Metformin with Insulin for glycemic control and neonatal outcomes in Indian women with gestational diabetes who fail dietary management.

title: Propranolol vs Topiramate for Migraine Prophylaxis in Indian Adults

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Episodic or chronic migraine per ICHD-3 criteria
additional: At least 4 migraine days per month
Failed or intolerant to at least one acute treatment

summary: A head-to-head comparison of Propranolol and Topiramate for migraine prevention in Indian patients, assessing efficacy, tolerability, and quality of life outcomes.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Early Intervention with Methotrexate-Tofacitinib in Indian Patients
exclusion_criteria: Prior biologic or JAK inhibitor use
Active TB or latent TB without prophylaxis
summary: Evaluating early combination therapy with Methotrexate plus Tofacitinib versus Methotrexate plus placebo in Indian patients with early, active Rheumatoid Arthritis.

title: AI-Guided Insulin Titration App for Type 2 Diabetes in Rural India
sponsor: IIT Bombay Healthcare AI Lab / Eli Lilly India

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Type 2 DM on basal insulin for at least 3 months
additional: Willing to use glucose monitoring device
Residing in rural or semi-urban area

summary: Testing an AI-powered mobile application for automated basal insulin dose titration in Type 2 DM patients in rural Indian healthcare settings.

title: Aducanumab Safety and Efficacy in Indian Patients with Early Alzheimer's Disease

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: MCI due to AD or mild AD dementia
additional: Amyloid PET positive or CSF biomarker positive

summary: Evaluating the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of Aducanumab in Indian patients with early-stage Alzheimer's disease confirmed by amyloid biomarkers.

title: Sacubitril-Valsartan in Heart Failure with Preserved Ejection Fraction in Indian Patients

additional: At least one HF hospitalization in past 12 months or elevated filling pressures

summary: A trial evaluating Sacubitril-Valsartan versus Valsartan in Indian patients with heart failure and preserved ejection fraction.

title: Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy for Depression in Indian Cancer Survivors

inclusion_criteria.diagnosis: Cancer survivor (any solid tumor) with moderate depression (PHQ-9 score 10-19)
additional: Completed primary cancer treatment at least 3 months ago
Not on antidepressants or on stable dose for 8 weeks

summary: Evaluating the efficacy of an 8-week Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy program for depression and quality of life in Indian cancer survivors.
